content: be the back of the head 1-4 single_crochet 24 ch1 turn - switch to brown on last stitch of row 4 do not ch1 tie the loose ends together to secure 15 slip_stitch into the last stitch of r14 marked stitch turn ch1 single_crochet into same stitch replace stitch marker as this will continue to be the last stitch of the rounds now - increase single_crochet 5 around 56 don t worry about the little gaps you will fix this when you sew on the ears 16 increase single_crochet 6 around 64 17-20 single_crochet around 4r of 64 eyes are placed on front of head between rounds 14-15 about 9 stitches apart 21 increase single_crochet 7 around 72 22-26 single_crochet around 5r of 72 27 decrease single_crochet 7 around 64 28 decrease single_crochet 6 around 56 29 decrease single_crochet 5 around 48 30 decrease single_crochet 4 around 40 31 decrease single_crochet 3 around 32 32 decrease single_crochet 2 around 24 switch back to green on the last stitch 33 single_crochet around 24 tie loose ends together to secure before weaving in the ends 34 single_crochet around 24 stuff head - i used a stuffing stick to push extra stuffing up into the front to creat a sort of snout shape between & under the eys 35 increase single_crochet 2 around 32 36-37 single_crochet around 2r of 32 38 increase single_crochet 3 around 40 39-40 single_crochet around 2r of 40 41 increase single_crochet 4 around 48 42 single_crochet around 48 43 increase single_crochet 5 around 56 44 single_crochet around 56 45 increase single_crochet 6 around 64 46-50 single_crochet around 5r of 64 51 decrease single_crochet 6 around 56 52 decrease single_crochet 5 around 48 53 decrease single_crochet 4 around 40 54 decrease single_crochet 3 around 32 55 decrease single_crochet 2 around 24 56 decrease single_crochet 2 around 18 57 decrease single_crochet around 12 stuff body 58 decrease around 6 fo close hole weave in end use olive green to stitch on nose & mouth - nose - work over rounds 17 & 18 over the 3-4 stitches centered between the eyes about 8-10 overlapping stitches mouth - working between rounds 23 & 24 stitch over top of 3sc bring needle out 3 single_crochet away and then back into the center work one long stitch over all 6sc on top of the first stitches bring needle back to the middle and make a small stitch over the top lip then back to one side then make one more long stitch over all 6sc to create the bottom lip bring needle out the side of the head tie a knot then tuck tail/knot back inside the head to hide ears - make 4 pieces 2 brown - 2 olive green make the brown pieces first 1 ch2 single_crochet 2 ch1 turn increase 2 3 ch1 turn increase x2 4 4 ch1 turn increase single_crochet 2 increase 6 5 ch1 turn single_crochet 6 6 ch1 turn increase single_crochet 5 7 7-8 ch1 turn single_crochet
